author: Muscat Daily
title: Oman- Meethaq Sharia'a board approves certificates for sukuk and new products
text:
(MENAFN - Muscat Daily) Meethaq's Sharia'a Supervisory Board met for the second meeting this year under the chairmanship of Sheikh Dr Ali Qaradaghi in presence of all board members and Sulaiman al Harthy group general manager of Islamic banking at Bank Muscat.  The meeting was held in Jeddah Saudi Arabia as all board members were participating in the Al Baraka Banking Group's 'Symposium for Islamic Economy'.
The board reviewed Meethaq's financial performance in early 2015 takaful insurance products and approving certificates for sukuk and new products. In addition the board reviewed Meethaq banking policies and approved certificates for some products and the audit report a Bank Muscat press release said on Monday.   
Harthy said the meeting was a success as the members discussed important topics such as Meethaq's banking policies and workflow. Meethaq is proud to have on board some of the brightest minds on Islamic finance to chart the way forward. The Sharia'a board has made valuable contributions in establishing Meethaq as the leading Islamic banking service provider in Oman.'
Meethaq offers a full suite of Islamic banking products. The Sharia'a compliant products and services include savings account current account home finance auto finance credit card mobile banking etc. Presently Meethaq has 11 branches across the Sultanate and plans to expand the branch network as well as launch new products and services to complement the unique Islamic banking experience
Meethaq has adopted the best practices in Islamic banking and finance worldwide to combine a robust model which protects customers and complements the Islamic banking industry the press release added.
